DOC.brief_summary: Examine effectiveness weight gain prevention intervention positively affect body mass index 2-year college student
DOC.brief_title: Choosing Healthy Options College Environments Settings
DOC.detailed_description: The goal research develop test innovative strategy help prevent unhealthy weight gain college student attend 2-year community technical college . The intervention propose Phase 2 , refine formative experience Phase 1 , base social ecological social network model student randomized condition . Students ( n=440 ) BMIs 20.0 34.9 recruited participate intervention trial last 24 month . After initial screen consent procedure , student complete baseline measure include : assessment body composition ; blood pressure blood draw ; behavioral psychosocial survey ; medical weight history two 24-hour online dietary recall . After completion baseline assessment , student randomize treatment control condition . Students randomized intervention condition participate 1-credit course offer 2-year college focus eat , activity , sleep stress management way help maintain achieve healthy weight ; three course section offer accommodate student ' schedule need learn preference . A web-based social network support component introduce part course continue intervention channel 20 month follow 1-credit course . This supported intervention phase use study-designed website reinforce , inform encourage exchange support intervention participant . Students ask track weight weight-control behavior website intervention staff interact participant electronically phone call offer encouragement help problem solve . Control student receive health assessment usual care include exist public health information maintain healthy weight information regard health service offer school 's campus . The effectiveness sustainability intervention approach evaluate . The primary aim examine effectiveness 24-month weight gain prevention intervention positively affect BMI 2-year college student . Our hypothesis student randomize intervention condition experience small increase mean BMI post treatment , compare student randomize control condition . The secondary aim study : 1 ) Examine effectiveness weight gain prevention intervention positively affect weight 2-year college student ' 2 ) compare effect intervention control group regard change BMI weight baseline four month baseline 12 month .
DOC.criteria: Age 1835 year Intending available 24 month intervention Unable provide inform consent BMI < 18.5 kg/m2 , > /=35 kg/m2 Household member study staff Past plan ( within next 24 month ) weight loss surgery ( e.g . gastric bypass , lap band , liposuction ) ; current participation commercial weight loss program ( e.g . Weight Watcher 's , Jenny Craig ) ; current plan enrollment another diet/physical activity/weight loss intervention study Regular use systemic steroid , prescription weight loss drug , and/or diabetes medication ( oral inject ) . `` Regular use '' define `` take medication day week previous month '' Current treatment eat disorder Cardiovascular event ( heart attack , stroke , episode heart failure , revascularization procedure ) within last 6 month Current treatment malignancy ( nonmelanoma skin cancer ) Investigator discretion Currently pregnant give birth within last 6 month , currently lactate breastfeed within last 3 month , actively plan pregnancy within next 24 month . Systolic BP screen > /= 160 mmHg diastolic BP > /= 100 mmHg . If BP exceed level , participant return rescreening evaluate treated hypertension . Weight loss 15 lb past three month Trying gain weight .
